title: Plz revert a huge, gamebreaking Master Yi nerf.
body:
His taunt no longer says "Your skills are inferior!"

This is a huge nerf to his end-game where he spams taunt in front of enemy fountain.

Oh godsh you guys are hilarious

One thing they actually should change for real is the inconsistency of Alpha Strike where it will sometimes fail to dodge damage while you're supposed to be untargetable. Not talking about cases where you get hit by DOT spells beforehand, talking about regular direct damage spells.
master yi's Q isn't meant to make you dodge **targeted** spells, only **skill shots**. pretty sure they say so in his champion spotlight
It makes him untargetable, which means the only things that should be dealing damage to him are DoTs currently applied and tether effects. He shouldn't be hit by anything else.
Don't untargetable (not invulnerable) champs still get hit by AOE?
Nope.

{{champion:114}} does...

AoE messes Fiora up hard during her ult. She can't control where she goes so if she dashes through a big AoE effect she still takes damage, and AoE CC can knock her right out if it. I had a game where the enemy {{champion:236}} / {{champion:1}} bot lane killed me multiple times during my ult in team fights. Ult'd Lucian to escape death but died to The Culling anyway (got most of the ult off before it killed her too). Dived and ult'd Lucian only to get one hit off as Annie ult'd on top of him and stunned me out of my ult.

I recall Riot said also saying that Yi's Q drops projectiles like {{champion:105}} trollpole whereas Fiora's ult does not so maybe it's just a weird targeting thing?
Fiora is temporarily targetable whenever she attacks. Yi isn't targetable until he finishes, so it should be impossible to hurt him.
If the targeted spell is launched BEFORE his Q, there's no avoiding it. He's untargetable during his Q, but not invulnerable.
{{champion:133}}  we stop with the puns already?
hmm.. Idk.. but pretty sure they said the same thing for {{champion:238}} 's ult - "He becomes briefly untargetable" which SHOULD mean that they dont get hit by any spells like zhoya's?
Untargetable =/= Invincible
{{champion:86}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:127}} Voice spam master race

+1

Jokes aside, a game-breaking error/bug is that whenever Master Yi alpha-strikes dragon, it resets it's "activation" causing Yi to be pushed back each time. Same happens with Baron ( although, you awkwardly slide down baron for half a second while it gets a free hit on you)

I think this is caused by alpha strike landing you DIRECTLY on the target as opposed to auto-attack range for other dashes

I'd love for a response from a rioter as this means you can't solo baron unless you're incredibly fed/ well into the game, and this wasn't the case before the summoner's rift update, so it's by no means a cry for buffs. Rather a plea to revert a "bug-nerf" 

Pls Rito {{item:3070}} {{champion:11}} {{item:3070}}

About baron, that's not a glitch. It happens with all targetted dashes. I don't really like this, though. They should just make him completely impassible and have you spawn right next to him instead of inside of him immediately.

Oh yes, that is incredibly frustrating when you are full build with bruiser Yi and have a high AD, high lifesteal item set and yet are scared to use Q because otherwise Baron fks you up, and early game where you can't Q dragon for free hits.

Actually, I remember back in preseason, you COULD actually Q-dodge the dragon's initial hit and pushback for a free auto onto Dragon, which made it extremely easy to solo.

He still says "Your skills are inferior!"

He just has one or two other lines of dialogue with his taunt.

Unless something bugged out and Yi lost the quote.
I tried; spammed taunt, he never says it anymore.
Literally just loaded up a custom game, he still says it... maybe it has to do with a certain skin or something? I don't know.
i use assassin yi.
dont play yi. problem solved.
Didn't know nerfs counted as game breaking
Riot dont even know about his existence.
yeah that's pretty sad.

Yi is in that weird crossroads where he's not bad enough to need substantial buffs, and not good enough to warant Riot or general playerbase attention that might seek to rectify his power positioning. It's kind of interesting actually. 

Just be glad he can still disjoint projectiles because that's baller as hell, "your skills are inferior" or not.
